data.title: Lovely atmosphere and good food.
data.text: We happened upon this place having arrived in Springfield when we were travelling "66" on the weekend celebrating the 90 year anniversary.  The menu was interesting and the food superb.  We had the crackbread to share followed by the Bacon burger and onion rings for me and the ford chicken and donuts for my fiancé.  The food was outstanding and the selection of ale was just as good.  I would happily recommend to anyone in or visiting Springfield.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: The menu had unique choices and the food was delicious! Also, the front of the restaurant was able to be opened to expose to the outside which is wonderful on a beautiful day!

data.title: Modern but cozy vibe right on Park Central Square
data.text: Attended an "after party" here, and appetizers were basic but done well (including an amazing fried avocado!). Plenty of local brews on tap and loads of standing tables and rails to hang out, chat with friends, and enjoy a beautiful evening with a fully open end partition facing the square. No hype here, just basics done well. Only reason for a 4 rather than a 5 are the tight quarters when it gets full, including the narrow stairway to the upstairs bar and smaller hangout area. Plus some overly faux architectural enhancements ("stone" castle column? Probably not an original piece...).

data.title: Had an awesome dinner here
data.text: Had the Pork Cutlet with Gouda mash and it was very tasty, they also have several beers on tap and an assortment of specialty drinks.

data.title: Cool place for dinner and drinks. Good menu; great location
data.text: Four of us met there for dinner and it was really good. Two of us had the snapper and thought it was good; another had the open face and she loved it. Service was friendly but a little slow. Had to go find them to get the check.

data.title: Great atmosphere, great service, awesome waffles!
data.text: Was a little reluctant to try this place out but man was I wrong! Can't say enough about the staff. We had a large, rowdy group and they got us all taken care of I short order. The bar fixed excellent drinks and the food was unreal. Try the turkey and waffle hot brown for something different. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: The freaking bomb!
data.text: Super good appetizers highly recommend the crab puffballs. Shrimp. Drinks are amazing from the bar. The salmon is delicious and the filet mignon on is to die for! A big win.

data.title: Great Place with Something Different
data.text: This place was fantastic. I had a lunch meeting there, and the menu was awesome. They have great choices, something for everyone, and the variety and innovate menu was very exciting. I had the Apple, Bacon "Panini" which was actually thick cut bacon, apples, and cheese on a huge waffle! It was so good. The mac & cheese was great, but the brussel sprouts with the vanilla syrup was absolutely amazing!

data.title: Right in the middle of downtown right on Route 66
data.text: Dinner at the Civil Kitchen was with a large group of Route 66 "roadies" and the fact that it was on Route 66 made it even nicer.  The menu is a little eclectic so it may be a little hard to come up with a menu choice that doesn't have a few "interesting" additions.  My choice for dinner was excellent - tasty, well-prepared and served by a friendly staff.

data.title: Something different downtown
data.text: A group of us ate at Civil Kitchen for a friend's birthday.  Our waitress was very helpful, offering suggestions to those of us who hadn't eaten there before.  She was patient with us as we all chatted and slowly ordered.  We ordered drinks and an appetizer, Crack Bread, to start with.  The bartender did a great job with our drinks and the Crack Bread is deserving of the name.  My husband had the Open Face Hot Brown and I had the Chicken and Waffles.  We both were very pleased with our choices.  The chicken is hand breaded and the seasoning is incredible.  The sauces are fun to try.  I enjoyed the vanilla bean and cinnamon maple syrup. We will definitely be back to try some other menu items.

data.title: Unique and Fun
data.text:
My son took me to Civil Kitchen for an early supper.  Our waiter was great and knew the menu well.  The menu had lots of choices for all tastes and appetites.  My son had a burger served on a waffle.  I ordered a chicken sandwich that was absolutley wonderful.  There were many sides to choose from.  Each menu selection comes with a side choice.  We had gouda mashed potatoes and fries.  Both were amazing.  They also offer a dinner selection where you can order 4 sides!  It looked great too.  
The atmosphere is causal and relaxed.  The bar offers a drink for every taste!  We will definitely return!

data.title: Wonderful!!
data.text: We were driving thru springfield on our way to Oklahoma and we stopped at Civil Kitchen.  The atmosphere is great!  Our bartender/server was wonderful and the food was fresh and delicious!

data.title: A Good Time on Old Route 66
data.text:
I was in town for the 2016 Birthplace of Route 66 Festival and wanted eat somewhere that offered local flavor and a good beer selection.  One of my local friends recommended Civil Kitchen and I'm oh-so-glad they did!

The aforementioned suggestion made the rounds, and I was joined by over 30 of my Route 66 buddies from across the country.  Our servers were in great spirits and nobody I talked to felt neglected for being in such a large party.

I kept it simple and got chicken tenders; the wife got the bourbon-glaze steak.  While I'm not a very adventurous eater, I opted for the jalapeno gravy for my food -- and it was STELLAR!  I had a bit of my wife's steak, too, and it had an amazing flavor.  The beer selection was vast; happily, when I told my server my likes/dislikes, she recommended a brew that I was very happy with.  

All in all, an excellent experience.  I will be back any time I make it to Springfield!

data.title: Surprising Salmon Filet
data.text: Asked the waitress her favorite dish and she said salmon hands down.  We started with the crack bread, aptly named it was scrumptious.  I had the salmon served with steamed broccoli and fried potato's, all cooked to perfection.  One client had grilled cheese and onion rings, the other had a vegie burger and fry's.  We all had one beer, with Tip $75 total, we'll be back.......

data.title: Chicken & Waffles and Civil Burger are MUSTS!
data.text:
I was relieved to find that this location no longer has the look (or better yet, the smell) of the former Trolley's! Wish there was a hostess who guided us where to sit since it was a bit confusing walking in, but they have a very cool atmosphere and a very unique menu! Talked to our server a bit & he let us know that everything is made from scratch every day, and you can definitely tell! I got the frog legs and a side of truffle straws along--YUM! Didn't get to order a beer due to having to have to be somewhere afterward, but beer selection looked great. Will definitely be back (can't wait to try the Saturday boil!!!!)

**UPDATE**
Have been back and ordered the Chicken & Waffles (because I heard it was THE thing to order in town) and the Civil Burger. I must say, the Chicken & Waffles were ah-maaazing and lived up to all the buzz--hand breaded, large pieces of juicy chicken atop a waffle accompanied by your choice of gravy or sauce (there's so many to choose from!!) I loved the Port Mushroom Gravy and the Vanilla Maple Syrup--the sweet & savory combo is a foodie's dream!  I was anticipating that dish to be awesome, so that was no shocker, but the pleasant surprise was the Civil Burger. I can honestly say it's probably the best burger in town!

data.title: Good eats, strange menu
data.text: I have been twice in the past two months and enjoyed both trips.  the chicken and donuts seem weird but are actually good as well as the brussel sprouts and the flash fried kale

data.title: Good lunch fare, Lots of beer options
data.text: Between the three bars in Civil, there are 29 beer options on tap.  Our lunch salads were good with friendly service. This would be a cool place for the younger crowd.

data.title: Trendy & tasty!
data.text: We went with a large group and they were very accommodating. The menu is very different, which is exciting because I enjoy trying new flavor combinations. Our party ordered everything from chicken and waffles to paninis, and no one was dissatisfied. Their special syrups and sauces make the food that much better. Would definitely return!

data.title: best onion rings around
data.text: came down to square for the slide the square event, as many food trucks were "promised" yeah.. there were two.. a taco truck and a whipped dessert one. stopped at the civil kitchen booth to get some cotton candy, which was a little sticky due to the hot day and were given cards for half off appetizers, so we decided to visit, since it was right there. liked the location and the atmosphere. we just got the onion rings and they were really the best we have ever had, especially with the sriracha mayo. little pricey for our budget normally at 9 bucks so were glad for the coupon. service was friendly and good.

data.title: Great dinner, nice atmosphere and incredible desserts.
data.text: Really good food and very large portions.  Desserts were so good.  Monkey bread, donuts and butter cake with ice cream were crazy good.  I had the petite filet, cooked perfect!  Brussels sprouts were some of the best I've had.  Definitely recommend this one.
